content_segments.text: For the ATEX project, you've specified a GDB housing with 600x600mm dimensions and a 750mm housing length.
To finalize the configuration, I need to know the required airflow capacity.

turns.content: Here is the configuration for the ATEX project.The system is exposed to an Explosive Atmosphere. Static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. To mitigate this risk, ensure:Grounding/earthing of all metallic housing componentsAnti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding stripsEquipotential bonding between all housing sectionsCompliance with EN 60079-0 and EN 60079-31The housing corrosion class is C2.**Note**: Explosive atmosphere (ATEX zone) requires all components to be electrostatically grounded to prevent spark ignition. Consider products with this trait**Note**: Explosive atmospheres require all components to prevent ignition sources. Static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS: (1) Grounding/earthing of all metallic housing components to prevent static discharge; (2) Anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips â€” standard filter media is NOT suitable for ATEX zones; (3) Equipotential bonding between all housing sections; (4) Compliance with EN 60079-0 (general requirements) and EN 60079-31 (dust ignition protection). For Zone 22 (combustible dust): equipment must meet minimum Category 3D protection level. Non-negotiable â€” follow engineering recommendation

content_segments.text: . Static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. To mitigate this risk, ensure:
Grounding/earthing of all metallic housing components
Anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips
Equipotential bonding between all housing sections
The housing corrosion class is C2.
**Note**: Explosive atmosphere (ATEX zone) requires all components to be electrostatically grounded to prevent spark ignition. Consider products with this trait

**Note**: Explosive atmospheres require all components to prevent ignition sources. Static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS: (1) Grounding/earthing of all metallic housing components to prevent static discharge; (2) Anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips â€” standard filter media is NOT suitable for ATEX zones; (3) Equipotential bonding between all housing sections; (4) Compliance with EN 60079-0 (general requirements) and EN 60079-31 (dust ignition protection). For Zone 22 (combustible dust): equipment must meet minimum Category 3D protection level. Non-negotiable â€” follow engineering recommendation
